CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many labels are in this radar chart?
How many dimensions are in this radar chart?

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the clockwise direction from Rental Yield?
SRP.A: The next dimension clockwise from Rental Yield is Transaction Volume Growth

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the counterclockwise direction from Rental Yield?
SRP.A: The next dimension counterclockwise from Rental Yield is Yearly Price Growth Rate.

SRP.Q: On the Yearly Price Growth Rate, is the point for berg inside or outside the point for stad?
SRP.A: On the Yearly Price Growth Rate, the point for berg is outside the point for stad.

VPR.Q: Which label encloses the largest score in the radar chart?
VPR.A: label {Rental Yield} encloses the largest score

VPR.Q: What are the strongest and weakest dimension of berg?
VPR.A: The strongest aspect is {Rental Yield}, while the weakest aspect is{ Rate of Newly Built Homes}.

VPR.Q: On dimension Transaction Volume Growth, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Transaction Volume Growth, label {shire} scores the highest.

VPR.Q: On dimension Rental Yield, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Rental Yield, label {stad} scores the lowest.

VE.Q: What is the value of berg on the Transaction Volume Growth in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of berg on the Safety dimension is {65}.

VE.Q: What is the value of shire on the Rental Yield in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of shire on the Safety dimension is {58}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value of label shire across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum value of shire across all dimensions is {64}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value of label stad across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum value of stad across all dimensions is {57}.

SC.Q: What is the average value of Transaction Volume Growth
SC.A: The average value of Transaction Volume Growth is {62.33}.

SC.Q: What is the average value of berg
SC.A: The average value of berg is {60.0}.

SC.Q: What is the difference in Rental Yield between berg and stad?
SC.A: The difference in Rental Yield between berg and stad is {32}.

NF.Q: Which labels have scores below 33 for the Yearly Price Growth Rate dimension? Please list the labels and corresponding scores.
For berg in the radar chart, which dimensions have scores between 47 and 70? Please list the dimensions and corresponding scores.
NF.A: {Yearly Price Growth Rate} is {64}, {Transaction Volume Growth} is {65}

NF.Q: Which labels have scores above 66 for the Rate of Newly Built Homes dimension? Please list the labels and corresponding scores.

NC.Q: For stad, which dimension has a higher score: Rate of Newly Built Homes or Transaction Volume Growth?
NC.A: {Transaction Volume Growth} has a higher score than Rate of Newly Built Homes for stad.

NC.Q: On Rate of Newly Built Homes, which label has a higher score: stad or the shire?
NC.A: {stad} has a higher score on Rate of Newly Built Homes compared to shire.

NC.Q: For stad, which dimension has a higher score: Transaction Volume Growth or Rate of Newly Built Homes or Rental Yield?
NC.A: {Transaction Volume Growth} has a higher score for stad.

NC.Q: For stad, which dimension has a higher score: Transaction Volume Growth or Yearly Price Growth Rate or Rate of Newly Built Homes?
NC.A: {Transaction Volume Growth} has a higher score for stad.

MSR.Q: For shire, based on the data shown in the radar chart, which dimension does it most need to improve?
MSR.A: shire most needs to improve its {Yearly Price Growth Rate}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the strongest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the strongest overall capability is {berg}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the weaknest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the weaknest overall capability is {shire}.
